entries.title: Allow self-generated CONNECT tunnels to use HTTP2
Add new policy "DisableVpnHostBypass" to disable automatic VPN detection
Entering emails when sharing data with others only works if Enter key is pressed after typing
Dragging rules to reorder them does not work
Changes through App Configuration for DefaultNetworkCaptureList are not applied
"DefaultBypassList" policy on macOS does not work correctly when Cisco VPN client is installed
Application crash on startup when running on Fedora 41 or newer versions
Rule manual response will accept invalid HTTP status line without correcting it
Overview tab can show invalid timings when loading data from saved snapshots
App menu can show invalid items after changing the user account
Update third-party dependencies to mitigate potential security vulnerabilities
Allow using custom CA certificates
Add live or saved sessions to existing snapshots
HTTP 407 errors returned from Fiddler proxy when using some third party services like Zscaler
MessagePack request body not decoded
Update third-party dependencies to mitigate potential security vulnerabilities
Add new tools menu with Advanced Replay, Decode Value and AutoSave features
Add support for AutoSave to automatically and periodically save live session data
Add menu option to trust Fiddler CA in the Windows Machine Certificate Store
Automatically enable HTTPS capturing after Fiddler CA certificate is trusted
Show a warning on macOS when enabling system proxy if Cisco AnyConnect VPN is running and add the VPN host to the bypass list
Sessions used for automatic authentication are not marked as closed after they are done
Decode content popup is now opened in a separate window
Added option for automatic Windows authentication including Kerberos and NTLM
Updated title bar UI
Some headers may become hidden in the Composer tab when there are many values
Show a dialog when Fiddler cannot set a proxy for the current user on Windows
Endless loader in body inspector for empty chunked response
Request form data not shown correctly in inspector when content encoding is set in request headers
When a rule's manual response starts with an invalid symbol the whole response text is deleted
Adding a second manual response action to a rule overwrites unsaved changes in other manual response actions
Some rules keyboard shortcuts are triggered from the Composer URL address bar
Update third-party dependencies to mitigate potential security vulnerabilities
Minor text fixes
Redesigned keyboard shortcuts for most used user flows and new keyboard shortcuts dialog
Redesigned Sizes view provides more detailed information for single or multiple selected sessions
Moving the Session Selection in Live Traffic Grid should not require Enter
Unable to install on clean Windows machine when starting the installer from Downloads folder
Add information in Messages inspector that server-sent events over HTTP/1.1 cannot be displayed
Show total sum in Timings table
When session is deleted clear the content from inspectors too
Cannot scroll to the bottom of the Columns dropdown
Rules now match requests before they're sent and responses before they're received for more precise traffic handling
Updated rule editor UI now shows the exact match time, flags when a rule won't execute as expected, and provides suggestions to fix it
Rule actions can now be reordered using drag and drop
Text areas in the rule editor window automatically expand to fit their content
Added zoom control shortcuts to rules editor dialog
Updated UI and expandable text areas for the advanced filter dialog
Selecting parent or child requests in the live traffic grid does not update the sessions list
Error when trying to accept EULA
Rules with manual response actions will sometimes lose their response body after saving
Add a settings menu to the Timings view in the Overview Tab
Add an Auth Inspector tab for requests
Replace HTTP Version and TLS version match conditions with separate client and server values for rules and filters
Improved performance in the Inspectors tab when reviewing captured sessions
Application fails to open on Windows due to invalid COMSPEC environment variable
Some macOS and Linux systems generate numerous warnings and slow down capture when resolving port numbers to process names
Dialog for unsaved changes appeared unnecessarily when closing the rules window without making any changes

Show a warning that not all timing details are available in the Overview inspector when working with older snapshots
Move Rules builder dialog to a separate detached window
Add a group with predefined Rules templates covering common usage cases

Show notification when information is copied from the timings timeline

Redesigned Timings view provides more detailed information for single or multiple selected sessions
Protobuf is now the default message inspector for gRPC sessions

The application status bar now shows the number of active session breakpoints

Update third-party dependencies to mitigate security issues

Update third-party dependencies to mitigate security issues

Remove "Do not show again" option for unsaved changes prompt in Composer requests so the dialog will always be displayed

UI fixes for Rule builder dialog, Inspectors and Sessions grid
Update third-party dependencies to mitigate security issues
Add a search option for request and response body content when searching in sessions and streaming messages
Add a new column in the sessions grid - "Session State", indicating whether the session is opened or closed
Rename "Protocol" session column to "Scheme". Add new "Protocol" session column with values to allow filtering streaming sessions
Add automatic Zstandard (zstd) decryption of sessions using such compression
Add user prompt to disable video hardware acceleration in case application UI crashes on startup
Add hint to open messages in streaming sessions (e.g. WebSocket, gRPC) in the response inspector
Update third party dependencies to fix security issues
Do not capture streaming sessions (e.g. gRPC) if "Ignore certificate errors" option is off and there is a problem with the server certificate

Live sessions tab might show older sessions as new when after lot of sessions have been captured
Performance issues if trying to capture a lot of concurrent sessions

UI fixes related to updated application look

State of word wrap inspectors toggle is not persisted
Update ciphers for encryption of saved, shared and exported .saz file - you need to update passwords to apply the new encryption

Update third-party dependencies to mitigate security issues
Introduce new approach for active/inactive selections and focus state
Update application colors for light and dark theme and remove the light blue and dark blue themes
Update icons and style of the application
Add more options in the grid for gRPC messages and SSE - Copy all and Quick search
Update third party dependencies to fix security issues
gRPC capturing hangs when there is a call without request/response parameters
Add the option to save a new snapshot from selected sessions of existing one
Add the option to duplicate a snapshot
Unable to capture HTTPS traffic on macOS Sonoma 14.4
In some cases users can turn on both System Proxy and Network Capture
null is shown in some cases in Composer Headers table

Show a dialog to disable hardware video acceleration if there is a problem detected that prevents the app from displaying correctly

gRPC automatic server reflection was not working in some cases

Add Rule match condition to match all sessions

Add paging to Overview inspector tabs when there are more than 100 selected sessions

Allow non-English letters in saved sessions and rulesets names

Improve application startup time

Update third-party dependencies to mitigate CVE-2024-0519
Add SocketIO decoding for WebSocket sessions
Add session breakpoints that pause the execution of any session before the request or response is sent and allow for making changes to the raw headers and body data manually
Update application font and icons for better readability on displays that use scaling

Apply security fixes for third-party dependencies
Add support for server-sent events
Make hex inspector the default one for WebSocket messages
Persist the selected view in the Inspectors Body tab

Allow the Composer UI to hide auto-generated headers, like "Host" and "User-Agent"
Update Composer UI for easier editing of headers, cookies, and parameters

Update dropdown lists UI in the rules and advanced filters dialogs

"Copy Full Summary" action in the session context menu changed to copy only the visible session list columns values to the clipboard

Add information in offline mode if the AD user doesn't match the one logged on the machine

Add information about active traffic sources in the application status bar

Update the application tray icon for macOS/Windows
Reorder the match conditions and actions lists in the Filters and Rules Editor dialogs

Update the predefined response actions in Rules
Discontinue support for Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows 8.1

Unable to parse some base64 encoded cookie values in Composer

Add option to persist preconfigured browser data
Add confirmation on Remove all button before clearing the captured sessions in the Live Traffic grid
Add option to choose where to install the root certificate authority for Windows
Unclear error message appears if login endpoints are unreachable
Unable to use vertical scroll of sessions in the Live Traffic grid in some cases

Update third-party dependencies to mitigate CVE-2023-4863
Improve raw and bulk edit operations in Composer
Download shared and updated resources after confirmation by the user
App freezes for a short time on macOS when opening certain websites
Performance is slowed down when capturing a high volume of sessions
Show upstream proxy information in the connection popup at the lower right of the application window
Add new vertical Composer layout, which can be switched on/off similar to the session inspectors layout

Link to account page for users with expired old subscriptions
Application error when trying to share a rule with manual response and no body

Update HTML page for Fiddler echo service and add a new HTML page for testing remote devices connectivity
Automatically disable the option for remote computers to connect after app quit for better security

Make custom columns available for all sessions tabs
Add indication when system proxy has unexpectedly changed

Move system proxy toggle in the toolbar below Live Traffic
Add informational dialog when the user enables the system proxy manually
Add a "+" button in Composer pane for creating new requests
Rename generated certificate authority to "Fiddler Everywhere Root Certificate Authority"
Show Fiddler specific home page in the initial tab when opening a preconfigured browser
Add official support for HTTP/2
Allow editing in the Raw tab in Composer requests

Show certificate information for saved sessions - the saved sessions will show you the state of the certificate when the traffic was captured with Fiddler Everywhere

Introduce a Timeline in the Overview inspector
Add a HEX body inspector
Add sorting for saved and shared sessions alphabetically
Update Sign in screen with more information for the possible steps
Show information in the application when there's a failed renewal payment

Add option to Save Filters - you can set match conditions and save them to re-use filters
Improve the buttons in the session list toolbar - expose most used buttons and hide the rest in a new dropdown
Add option to copy requests as code - select PowerShell, fetch, cURL or Python script format from the sessions list context menu
Add option to save the Request/Response body as a file - the option is available for the Raw, Preview and Body inspectors
Improve Compare Traffic option - difference in the URL protocol will be displayed as difference instead of a missing match
Improve Compare Traffic option - selecting a row with missing match will show its data in the inspectors

Skip decryption for domains added to bypass list - this makes it easy to ignore domains working with certificate pinning

Automatically select JSON body inspector when the Content-Type contains json

Inspection of WebSocket communication
Revamp of the Advanced filters with an enhanced UI and the ability to create complex filters
Updated the "My Resources" dialog for improved Getting Started experience configurations info
[BREAKING CHANGE] Set the minimum supported macOS version to Mojave
[BREAKING CHANGE] Single-click selection of the sessions now persists the currently selected Inspectors tab. Double-clicking will select the most appropriate one
Prevent leak of proxy settings when the application is closed or due to unexpected circumstances (like crash for some reason)
Improved the performance of marking multiple sessions simultaneously
Added a new HTTP Version column in the session lists (including Live Traffic)
Added a system tray icon with an indication if the application is actively capturing traffic
Added support for decoding of Bzip2 content encoding
Updated the application build dependencies to use .NET 6.0 and Electron 15.0
The application cannot start when the electron-settings.json file is invalid. Now, the app will recreate the file if such a situation happens.
Matching by Request/Response headers is case-sensitive in the Rule Builder. It has been revised to case-insensitive matching.
"Cannot read property 'split' of undefined" error is shown when trying to sign in and there's no access to AWS. The message now indicates what could be the problem.
The description of Composer's Content-Type header does not indicate what happens if you modify the value. Now, the description explains what needs to be done if you want to use a custom value.
Setting the Composer's Content-Type to 'application/xml' and switching to enter Body focuses the Text editor. Now, it will focus on the XML editor instead.
Matching sessions based on the Remote IP or Client IP does not work for saved/shared sessions.
Incorrect strip of Authorization Header if it happens to contain the letters NTLM
"Check for update" fails in some rare circumstances.
Time of notifications is in UTC time instead of local one.
Remember Fiddler Everywhere's window size and location and restore it on startup
Preconfigured browser capturing - capture HTTPS without trusting root certificate and without setting system proxy
Encrypt saved sessions with password - password protect sessions when saving them locally or in the cloud
Show notifications for user license changes
Unable to trust root certificate on macOS in some cases
Del button deletes the whole request instead of last letter when renaming

Unable to get back columns if you hide all of them

Introduce new simplified sign up flow

Issues with importing shared rules and duplicating rules, which have a manual response action
Issue when importing a rule with a regular expression in the match condition
Some UI color and size issues with the new dark theme

Missing text on some sign-in and sign-up error screens
EULA window not always showing the latest EULA content

When Fiddler Everywhere is unable to remove the proxy settings from the machine, next start leads to blank screen with no error and no indication for the user how to proceed

Expanded/collapsed states of rules is not persisted
Rules added to list are expanded by default, while they must be collapsed
Rules tab breaks when the rules are on more than one page and all of the rules on the last page are deleted
Toggled Decode (on) will remain toggled on Inspector change while content will be encoded again
UI themes - now you can choose between four different themes - two light and two dark
Overview inspector - a new tab which includes information about size, timing, and statistics of the selected session(s)

Rules - Redesigned and more powerful Auto Responder with a new Rule Builder supporting more scenarios, including modifications of requests and responses of already captured sessions, marking requests with different colors, and many more
Update Sign-Up and Sign-In screens design
Move to premium subscription only with free trial
Validity period for generated certificates is too long and mobile browsers reject them. Set the validity to be less than a year
Unable to set the system proxy on macOS when adapter name has multiple spaces next to each other
Unable to set the system proxy on macOS default Thunderbolt adapters
The system proxy is not respected when starting the application on macOS in some cases
The system proxy is not used for some of the initial requests during application startup
Add a text input to search in the URL and Headers of all sessions
Add an option to Share Feedback for the app
Enable sorting of captured traffic
Improve the app architecture to reduce the CPU usage during Live Traffic capturing
Migrate the login to case-insensitive system. Added specific UI for cases where the migration requires merge of multiple accounts in a single one
Update Electron to version 11, Angular to version 11 and .NET to version 5
Trust and enable certificate from grid icon sometimes does not set the 'Capture HTTPS traffic' to on
The app is not restarted after update on macOS Big Sur
ESC key does not close the Settings dialog
The app may fail to start when HTTPS_PROXY and HTTP_PROXY env variables are set
Traffic to localhost is not captured by default on macOS and Linux
Errors are raised when executing 'Check for updates' multiple times
The app's state is incorrect when there's no access to *.getfiddler.com
High memory usage during sharing
Add option to show Release Notes inside the app
Add 'Reset root certificate' option in the Settings
Add 'Remove root certificate' option in the Settings
The app does not work if any of the bash profiles has commands that print on the terminal (macOS and Linux)
The app does not capture traffic when 'Require an administrator password to access system-wide preferences' option is checked (macOS)
Rules Builder returns incorrect response when creating a rule from session and original response is encoded
The app is crashing silently due to not enough memory for starting the .NET Core process
Requests to localhost are not captured on Windows in some cases
Autoupdate does not work on Windows when user does not have access to Machine registry
Coloring is not applied in the Response Body inspectors on the first Composer execution
Analytics improvements
Show information for the HTTP Status code, Body Size, HTTP Version, Method in the Inspectors
Automatically select the most appropriate inspector when opening session, for example if the body content is JSON, the JSON inspector will be automatically selected.
Improve decode of sessions and move the button to be in the Inspectors sections
Add support for zoom in and zoom out
Import all formats to a new tab instead of loading them in the Live Traffic
Remove File menu and improve Import/Export UI
Add Context Menu option to export selected/unselected/all sessions directly to a specific format (without saving them in the local storage of the application)
Add keyboard and menu options for working with the window on macOS – hide, show others, etc.
Add keyboard and menu option for opening Settings
Add keyboard and menu options for navigating between tabs
Added and improved tooltips for all buttons
Log information for CPU and memory usage
UI in Sign In page is misaligned
Remote IP Column is not populated when importing Http Archive (HAR)
Validation messages for names of Folders in the Sessions tree on the left are incorrect.

Support ignore of server certificate errors – now you are able to set this (in the Settings) and work with your internal resources, for which you do not have a valid certificate. You can enable this through application's settings.

Support decode of Brotli (BR) Content Encoding – a popular encoding used in Firebase and many other popular resources – until now the responses were not readable, but with this release you just need to enable the decode option and the content will be converted to a human-readable one.

Improve Body, Date and Duration columns – we’ve used the opportunity to further improve the information we show to the users – the Body column is now called Body Size, it can be filtered with numeric comparison (was text before) and it has the unit. For Duration column we’ve also changed the filter to be numeric and we’ve added the unit. The Date column’s filter is now Calendar based, which makes it easy to get the information you need for specific date range. With all those changes we unlock new scenarios of using Fiddler Everywhere: finding sessions which take more than specified time has never been so easy. The same is valid for finding requests above specified size, etc.

Add predefined responses for Rules Builder rules – in Fiddler Classic there was an easy way to create responses for specific HTTP Codes, like 404, 301, etc. Now, the same is valid for Fiddler Everywhere – just create (edit) your AR rules and use the predefined responses from there. With a few clicks you can simulate 404 or 200 and see how your code behaves in this situation.

Add Client IP column – we’ve added a new column (it will be manually included in the list from the Columns menu) which shows the Client IP from which the request has been executed. This is extremely helpful when you capture requests from mobile devices and your machine as well.
Integrate in-app nudges – with this release we can now send targeted information (for webinars for example) to users who have allowed user tracking.
Add Open Application Logs Folder menu option –use the Help menu and the folder with the logs will be opened.
Set Fiddler Everywhere as default for opening .saz and .har files – with this release Fiddler Everywhere will be set as default for those file types.
Some OS commands cause errors on Fiddler Everywhere start on Windows
